Description: The royal head from a terracotta sphinx, wearing the nemes headdress with a tail at the rear and a uraeus above the brow. Solid and hand-modelled as an entity, with applied detail: uraeus, ears, eyeballs. Once attached to its sphinx body by plaster. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt, with overall buff-white slip, decorated with red and black painted details.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. If ancient, Ptolemaic of the second or first century BC.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3723)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
